info.name: Health LOCAL
info.description:
Simply change baseURL inside exported JSON-File via Search&Replace

for example
change
http://185.10.195.66/test/hvaa2/public
to 
http://185.10.195.66/test/hvaa2/public

request.description:
/**
       * search in courses 
       * query params:
       * search: (string) ,(search in title and description)
       * order_by: date, order (default order) (TODO)
       * order:asc,desc (default asc) (TODO)
       * lang:  get results for a language code "en,de,es,it" (default de)
       * PUBLIC
       * TODO: searches only in course_locale NOT in course_date_locale yet
       */
       
 good search term (which give results):
 orient, multi

/**
         * Get one course with every (many) available realted attribute
         * 
         * query params:
         * 
         * lang:  get results for a language code "en,de,es,it" (default de)
         * display: mini/full, default mini - how results are displayed, mini means the result are optimized for typical use
         * cat: include catory info (cat=1), default 0 (off)
         * profile: send profile=0 to exclude profile info, default on
         * contact: send contact=0 to exclude contact info, default on 
         * room: send room=0 to exclude room info, default on
         * dates: single course dates, dates=1 to turn on / include, default 0/off
         * user: include info about the current user related to course (default=1 ON)
         * rating: include rating info about the current course (default=1 ON)
         * 
         * probably its better to access single courses with uuid instead of id. (TODO)
         */

/**
       * a list of courses with filter, filters are based on table course_type
       * 
       * query params:
       * free: relates to is_free, 0/1 default 0
       * group: relates to is_group, default 1 
       * is_special not yey
       * 
       * order_by: date, order (default order) (orders categories)
       * order:asc,desc (default asc)
       * lang:  get results for a language code "en,de,es,it" (default de)
       * 
       * PUBLIC
       * 
       * TODO: connection to department not yet
       * 
       * Result List contains Categories on the first level, in there are the courses matching filter criteria 
       */

/**
       * returns seats and voting for a list of courses 
       * query params:
       * courses: (list, comma seperated) course_id,course_id,... if empty all courses are returned
       * returns: array[course_id:[seats_free,seats_totla][rating(float)]]
       */

/**
         * Get one course with every (many) available realted attribute
         * 
         * query params:
         * 
         * lang:  get results for a language code "en,de,es,it" (default de)
         * display: mini/full, default mini - how results are displayed, mini means the result are optimized for typical use
         * cat: include catory info (cat=1), default 0 (off)
         * profile: send profile=0 to exclude profile info, default on
         * contact: send contact=0 to exclude contact info, default on 
         * room: send room=0 to exclude room info, default on
         * dates: single course dates, dates=1 to turn on / include, default 0/off
         * user: include info about the current user related to course (default=1 ON)
         * rating: include rating info about the current course (default=1 ON)
         * 
         * probably its better to access single courses with uuid instead of id. (TODO)
         */

/**
       * get info about users courses info
       * some params (like is_not_interested) or combinations ((like "is_not_completed" and "upcoming" AND is_) might not make sense, but for flexibility in different senarios we keep them
       * 
       * params:
       * all: set to 1 to get all of the following, default 0
       * lang: language,default "de"
       * by default all are of, so provide at least one, or "all"
       * "is_payed" get courses user payed for, default 0,
       * "is_not_payed"
       * "is_completed"
       * "is_not_completed"
       * "is_booked"
       * "is_not_booked"
       * "is_interested"
       * "is_not_interested"
       * 'is_rated'
       * 'is_not_rated'
       * // by date, default OFF=0, provide all_dates=1 to turn all ON
       * 'past' : past courses, default 0
       * 'current': current current, default 0
       * 'upcoming': upcoming courses, default 0
       * 
       * to also get the actually visited courses add (Like on screen "My Activities")
       * "visited": visited=1 
       * 
       * todo: better output formating
       */

/**
       * get info about users courses info
       * some params (like is_not_interested) or combinations ((like "is_not_completed" and "upcoming" AND is_) might not make sense, but for flexibility in different senarios we keep them
       * 
       * params:
       * all: set to 1 to get all of the following, default 0
       * lang: language,default "de"
       * by default all are of, so provide at least one, or "all"
       * "is_payed" get courses user payed for, default 0,
       * "is_not_payed"
       * "is_completed"
       * "is_not_completed"
       * "is_booked"
       * "is_not_booked"
       * "is_interested"
       * "is_not_interested"
       * 'is_rated'
       * 'is_not_rated'
       * // by date, default OFF=0, provide all_dates=1 to turn all ON
       * 'past' : past courses, default 0
       * 'current': current current, default 0
       * 'upcoming': upcoming courses, default 0
       * 
       * to also get the actually visited courses add (Like on screen "My Activities")
       * "visited": visited=1 
       * 
       * todo: better output formating
       */

/**
          * Points and Open Ratings
          * 
          * response should be descriptive enought
          * params: no
          * 
         */

/**
          * this returns upcoming course_dates (single courses) in a timerange (days)
          * 
          * params
          * days: default 3
          * lang: default de
          *
          * Maybe we need additional params here like ->where("is_payed",'=',1) or
          * where("is_confirmed",'=',1) 
          * this could easily be done
         */

/**
  * get messages 
  * 
  * params
  * readstatus: default = 0 (only unread messages), set to 1 for only read messages, to 2 for all
  * use meta['count'] of response to get count
 */

/**
          * get action of week 
          * params: lang: default de, de/en
          * */

/**
          * this returns upcoming course_dates (single courses) in a timerange (days)
          * 
          * params
          * days: default 3
          * lang: default de
          *
          * Maybe we need additional params here like ->where("is_payed",'=',1) or
          * where("is_confirmed",'=',1) 
          * this could easily be done
         */

item.name: HELL0 & NEW TOKEN
item.description:
got to app/routes.php - Method Demotoken
you can set 
user_id 
and 
group_id
to create a new test token
copy printed token and use it in further requests

you migth switch to "RAW" Response in POSTMAN to see the Token

/**
       * list of ALL cats with / without courses
       * query params
       * include: set to "course" for related courses, default 0
       * order:asc,desc (default asc (Ascending default course order from 1 to x))
       * data:  full (category with locale and resource)
       *        mini (category with Title and full Image Path)
       * lang:  get results for a language code "en,de,es,it" (default de)
       * PUBLIC
       */

item.name: Category All -  with / without Courses (Mini / Full)

request.description:
/**
       * list of ALL cats with / without courses
       * query params
       * include: set to "course" for related courses, default 0
       * order:asc,desc (default asc (Ascending default course order from 1 to x))
       * data:  full (category with locale and resource)
       *        mini (category with Title and full Image Path)
       * lang:  get results for a language code "en,de,es,it" (default de)
       * PUBLIC
       */

/**
    * returns free timeslots in a month
    * public/api/profile/{PROFILE_ID}/calendar?month=-1
    * params: month (int) : next month is 1, previous month = -1 , default = 0 (current month)
    * 
    * RESULT: 
    * data: orderd list of timeslots (see result for further details)
    * meta.days_with: list with days (1-31) with free slots
    * meta.map: list with key day and ids of timeslots
    * 
    * Screen: "Offene Termine", S22, H-courses-seminar-calender
    */

/**
    * returns free timeslots in a month
    * public/api/profile/{PROFILE_ID}/calendar?month=-1
    * params: month (int) : next month is 1, previous month = -1 , default = 0 (current month)
    * 
    * RESULT: 
    * data: orderd list of timeslots (see result for further details)
    * meta.days_with: list with days (1-31) with free slots
    * meta.map: list with key day and ids of timeslots
    * 
    * Screen: "Offene Termine", S22, H-courses-seminar-calender
    */
returns profile info with course

/**
    * returns free timeslots in a month
    * public/api/profile/{PROFILE_ID}/calendar?month=-1
    * params: month (int) : next month is 1, previous month = -1 , default = 0 (current month)
    * 
    * RESULT: 
    * data: orderd list of timeslots (see result for further details)
    * meta.days_with: list with days (1-31) with free slots
    * meta.map: list with key day and ids of timeslots
    * 
    * Screen: "Offene Termine", S22, H-courses-seminar-calender
    */

/**
    * returns free timeslots in a month
    * public/api/profile/{PROFILE_ID}/calendar?month=-1
    * params: month (int) : next month is 1, previous month = -1 , default = 0 (current month)
    * 
    * RESULT: 
    * data: orderd list of timeslots (see result for further details)
    * meta.days_with: list with days (1-31) with free slots
    * meta.map: list with key day and ids of timeslots
    * 
    * Screen: "Offene Termine", S22, H-courses-seminar-calender
    */

/**
* toogle Remember Course
* returns updated user_course state
*/

/**
* toogle Remember Course
* returns updated user_course state
*/

provide a valid and existing UUID of a Course
or course_id 
uuid is first checked, if formally correct, but not existing it will return null

/**
       * list of ALL items
       * query params
       * order_by: date, order (default order)
       * order:asc,desc (default asc)
       * data:  full (category with locale and resource)
       *        mini (category with Title and full Image Path)
       * lang:  get results for a language code "en,de,es,it" (default de)
       * PUBLIC
       * TODO: parent child courses not yet implemented
       */

provide a valid and existing UUID of a Course
or course_id 
uuid is first checked, if formally correct, but not existing it will return null

provide either existing rating_id 
or course_id (deletes all from course)
or user_id (deletes all from user)

          * requires a user_id, which is not part of the POST but received from token

item.name: Screen 14 - Course Details
item.description: for more info see here Folder Course And Courses -> Single Course

request.description:
/**
         * Get one course with every (many) available realted attribute
         * 
         * query params:
         * 
         * lang:  get results for a language code "en,de,es,it" (default de)
         * display: mini/full, default mini - how results are displayed, mini means the result are optimized for typical use
         * cat: include catory info (cat=1), default 0 (off)

         * contact: send contact=0 to exclude contact info, default on 
         * room: send room=0 to exclude room info, default on

         * user: include info about the current user related to course (default=1 ON)
         * rating: include rating info about the current course (default=1 ON)
         * 
         * probably its better to access single courses with uuid instead of id. (TODO)
         */

maybe we need one more field in course_attendee
